message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the Global Findex dataset compiled by World Bank, we examine the impact of financial inclusion on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines the data from the National Nutrition Survey and the Indian Human Development Survey to investigate the relationship between maternal education and child nutrition in India.", "dataset": ["National Nutrition Survey", "Indian Human Development Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the International Wage Indicator survey as well as administrative data on job openings to understand the determinants of wage inequality across countries.", "dataset": ["International Wage Indicator survey", "administrative data on job openings"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "The paper employs a unique dataset that combines information about land cover dynamics from satellite images and socio-economic indicators from household surveys to explore the impact of forest conservation on rural livelihoods in Uganda.", "dataset": ["satellite images", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Environment", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Global Terrorism Database along with other datasets to empirically examine the impact of terrorism on cross-border trade flows in South Asia.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we used a multi-level dataset that includes individual, household, and community level data from the Demographic and Health Surveys to estimate the effects of early childhood exposure to electricity on educational and cognitive outcomes in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Education", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using the World Bank's Doing Business dataset and the World Management Survey, we examine the relationship between managerial quality and business regulations across countries.", "dataset": ["Doing Business dataset", "World Management Survey"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series together with climate data from the Global Historical Climatology Network to study the effects of temperature on migration patterns in the United States during the 20th century.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series", "Global Historical Climatology Network"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Migration"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a panel dataset on household financial transactions, along with administrative data on tax payments and civil registry records, to examine the impact of urbanization on fiscal capacity in Peru.", "dataset": ["panel dataset on household financial transactions", "administrative data on tax payments", "civil registry records"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite imagery data, geospatial data, and ecological data to investigate the impact of large-scale mining operations on biodiversity conservation in the Amazon rainforest.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "geospatial data", "ecological data"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}]
